text: Fun note, Dart was SUPPOSED to be added to Playstation All Stars as DLC with his rival potentially being Abe from Abe's Odyssey. They cut him though due to disinterest with the game and the sales not meeting their expectations and they figured Dart wouldn't change that. A petition exists online for him to come back and everything.

author: chocoman

text: One of the most underrated RPGs of all time. Sony outright REFUSED to do anything with it despite the MASSIVE potential it had as a series. Could have been their own Final Fantasy franchise. They even cancelled Dart's inclusion on PlayStation All-Stars Battle Royale. Why Sony? The Legend of Dragoon is a classic and has made its way into JRPG positive history for many reasons. Bring it back!

text:
Sony had the chance to revive the licence by putting Dart in that Playstation All Star Battle, but the DLC was cancelled.
There are some concept arts pretty easy to find, google them if you want, people ;)

author: Giorgio Parmanie

text:
Fully in agreement with the wasted potential of possible sequel(s). Seriously, it's far from the best RPG ever, but it's a damn fun game, quite memorable with a unique battle system that actually kept you paying attention instead of holding down the A button to win 99% of the time. So many other RPGs of the time got sequels (some good, some not so good) but not LoD? Very, very confusing. I'd bet LoD2 on PS4 would garner a ton of interest, for example.

Thanks.
author: HeroicPunk

text: It was a good series...what a rotten way to die.
author: Flammiedrum

text: I started playing this game for the first time a couple weeks and I'm on disc 4 and I love it. I do agree with the getting bored part because all I'm doing now is running from dungeon to dungeon really quickly but it's a longer game than I thought. Besides that, it's a great game with a unique battle system that probably could have flourished even more with a sequel.

author: DM

text: I still don't understand why this isn't a big exclusive franchise for Sony, I really think this is some wasted potential. LoD sold almost 2M copies worldwide, that's super impressive. This game still has a big following too. I personally thought this was a good RPG with great potential for an even better sequel. Interesting combat system, though I remember being quite bored with the game by the end; maybe a couple hours too long. Still, since FF4 I've always been a fan of dragoons!

text: Prequel would have been ideal in my opinion. LoD: The Dragon Campaign. Have it focused on Rose's story. She undoubtedly played a huge role in the game's history.
